sections.title: QUICK CLEANUP
sections.description: Fast cleanup tasks that free disk space and fix common issues. Safe to run daily.

tools.title: Empty Recycle Bin
tools.description: Permanently delete all files in Recycle Bin to free disk space
tools.detailed_description: Removes all files in the Recycle Bin to reclaim disk space. This permanently deletes items that were already marked for deletion, which helps keep storage tidy.
tools.notes: Files in the Recycle Bin are permanently deleted.
tools.when_to_use: When the Recycle Bin has accumulated files or disk space is low.

tools.title: Clear Temp Files
tools.description: Delete temporary files from %TEMP% and Windows\Temp folders
tools.detailed_description: Deletes temporary files from user and system temp folders. Clearing temp files frees space and can resolve minor app issues caused by stale temp data.
tools.notes: Some files in use are skipped to avoid disrupting active apps.
tools.when_to_use: When disk space is low or apps are behaving oddly.

tools.title: Flush DNS
tools.description: Clear DNS resolver cache to fix website connection issues
tools.detailed_description: Clears the DNS resolver cache used to translate domain names to IP addresses. This can fix connection errors when DNS entries are stale or incorrect.
tools.when_to_use: When websites fail to load or after network changes.

tools.title: Clear Browser Cache
tools.description: Clears cached files from installed web browsers.
tools.detailed_description: Removes cached images, scripts, and temporary files from Chrome, Firefox, Edge, and Brave. This can free significant disk space but will require websites to reload assets on first visit.
tools.notes: Does NOT clear passwords, bookmarks, or browsing history. Only clears cached files.
tools.when_to_use: When browsers feel sluggish or disk space is low.

tools.title: Clear Prefetch
tools.description: Remove Windows Prefetch cache files (requires admin)
tools.detailed_description: Windows Prefetch stores data about how applications start to speed up future launches. Clearing this cache frees disk space but temporarily slows app launches until the cache rebuilds (usually 1-2 days). Best used occasionally, not daily.
tools.notes: Windows rebuilds this cache automatically. Clearing too often can temporarily slow app launches.
tools.when_to_use: When disk space is low or after installing/uninstalling many programs.

tools.title: Clear RAM Standby
tools.description: Release memory held in standby list for active applications
tools.detailed_description: Releases memory held in the standby list so active apps can use it immediately. This can quickly free RAM without closing programs.
tools.when_to_use: When RAM usage is high or the system feels sluggish.

tools.title: Clear Update Cache
tools.description: Delete Windows Update download cache to fix stuck updates
tools.detailed_description: Deletes the Windows Update download cache to resolve stuck updates and reclaim disk space. Windows will re-download required update files after clearing.
tools.notes: Updates may need to re-download after clearing the cache.
tools.when_to_use: When updates fail to install or downloads are stuck.

tools.title: Reset MS Store
tools.description: Reset Microsoft Store cache to fix app download issues
tools.detailed_description: Resets the Microsoft Store cache and restarts its background services. This can fix issues with app downloads or updates.
tools.when_to_use: When Store apps will not download or update.

tools.title: Pause Updates
tools.description: Pause Windows Updates for 7 days
tools.detailed_description: Temporarily pauses Windows Updates for a short period. This is useful when you need to avoid restarts during important work.
tools.notes: Pausing updates delays security patches while the pause is active.
tools.when_to_use: When you need a short break from update prompts.

sections.title: MEMORY & DISK
sections.description: Deep cleaning and optimization. Some operations take several minutes.

tools.title: Disk Cleanup
tools.description: Launch Windows built-in Disk Cleanup utility
tools.detailed_description: Launches Windows Disk Cleanup to remove unnecessary system files and caches. This safely frees disk space without affecting personal files.
tools.when_to_use: When you need to reclaim disk space.

tools.title: Optimize Drives
tools.description: Run TRIM for SSD or defragmentation for HDD
tools.detailed_description: Runs TRIM for SSDs or defragmentation for HDDs to optimize storage performance. This can improve file access speed over time.
tools.notes: May take several minutes depending on drive size.
tools.when_to_use: When disk performance feels slow or after heavy file changes.

tools.title: Restart Explorer
tools.description: Restart Windows Explorer to fix taskbar/desktop issues
tools.detailed_description: Restarts Windows Explorer to refresh the taskbar, desktop, and file manager. Useful for fixing UI glitches without a full reboot.
tools.when_to_use: When the taskbar or desktop is unresponsive.

sections.title: NETWORK
sections.description: Network troubleshooting tools for connection issues.

tools.title: Reset TCP/IP
tools.description: Reset entire network stack to factory defaults (restart recommended)
tools.detailed_description: Resets the Windows network stack to default settings. This can resolve deep connectivity issues caused by corrupted network configuration.
tools.notes: Restart recommended after running this tool.
tools.when_to_use: When network connectivity is broken or unstable.

tools.title: Release/Renew IP
tools.description: Get new IP address from DHCP server to resolve conflicts
tools.detailed_description: Releases the current DHCP lease and requests a new IP address. This can resolve IP conflicts or stale leases.
tools.when_to_use: When you cannot reach the network or suspect IP conflicts.

tools.title: Network Stats
tools.description: Display network interface statistics
tools.detailed_description: Displays network interface statistics to help troubleshoot connectivity and bandwidth issues. This is informational only.
tools.when_to_use: When diagnosing network issues or monitoring activity.

sections.title: SYSTEM REPAIR
sections.description: Windows repair tools for corrupted files. These take 10-45 minutes.

tools.title: SFC Scan
tools.description: Run System File Checker to repair corrupted Windows files (10-30 min)
tools.detailed_description: Runs System File Checker to verify and repair corrupted Windows system files. This can fix crashes or missing components caused by file corruption.
tools.notes: Takes 10-30 minutes. Do not interrupt the scan.
tools.when_to_use: When Windows is unstable or system files are suspected to be corrupted.

tools.title: DISM Repair
tools.description: Repair Windows component store using DISM RestoreHealth (15-45 min)
tools.detailed_description: Uses DISM to repair the Windows component store and restore health. This can resolve update failures and system corruption.
tools.notes: Takes 15-45 minutes. Do not interrupt the scan.
tools.when_to_use: When SFC cannot repair files or updates fail repeatedly.

tools.title: CHKDSK
tools.description: Schedule disk check for next restart to find bad sectors
tools.detailed_description: Schedules a disk check on the next restart to scan for file system errors and bad sectors. This helps prevent data loss on failing drives.
tools.notes: Runs at next restart and can take hours on large drives.
tools.when_to_use: When you suspect disk errors or see file corruption warnings.

tools.title: Reset Windows Update
tools.description: Comprehensive Windows Update repair (stops services, clears cache)
tools.detailed_description: Resets Windows Update components, clears caches, and restarts services. This can resolve stuck updates and corrupted update downloads.
tools.notes: May need to re-download updates after the reset.
tools.when_to_use: When Windows Update fails or remains stuck.

sections.title: PRIVACY
sections.description: Reduce Windows data collection. These settings don't break Windows.

tools.title: Disable Telemetry
tools.description: Reduce Windows data collection to minimum allowed level
tools.detailed_description: Reduces diagnostic data collection to the minimum allowed by Windows. This limits telemetry while keeping core services functional.
tools.notes: May affect some Microsoft services that rely on diagnostics.
tools.when_to_use: When you want to minimize data collection.

tools.title: Disable Activity History
tools.description: Stop activity tracking and timeline sync
tools.detailed_description: Disables activity history and Timeline tracking. This prevents Windows from storing app and file usage across devices.
tools.notes: May affect Timeline and cross-device activity sync.
tools.when_to_use: When you prefer not to keep activity history.

tools.title: Disable Advertising ID
tools.description: Prevent personalized ads tracking
tools.detailed_description: Disables the Advertising ID used for personalized ads. This reduces targeted advertising across Windows apps.
tools.notes: May affect personalized experiences in some apps.
tools.when_to_use: When you want less ad tracking.

tools.title: Disable Cortana
tools.description: Turn off Cortana assistant and remove background process
tools.detailed_description: Turns off Cortana assistant and background processes. This can reduce background usage and improve privacy.
tools.notes: May affect voice assistant features and some Microsoft services.
tools.when_to_use: When you do not use Cortana and want fewer background tasks.

sections.title: SYSMAIN (SUPERFETCH)
sections.description: Controls whether Windows pre-loads apps into RAM. Disable on SSD + 8GB+ RAM systems.

tools.title: Disable SysMain
tools.description: Stop SysMain service and RAM preloading (recommended for SSD)
tools.detailed_description: Stops the SysMain (Superfetch) service to reduce disk and memory usage. This can help on SSD systems where prefetching provides less benefit.
tools.notes: Effects vary by hardware; SSD systems often benefit more than HDDs.
tools.when_to_use: When you have an SSD and want to reduce background disk activity.

tools.title: Enable SysMain
tools.description: Re-enable SysMain for HDD or low-RAM systems
tools.detailed_description: Re-enables the SysMain service for improved app preloading on HDDs or low-RAM systems. This can speed up app launches in some scenarios.
tools.notes: Effects vary by hardware; HDD systems often benefit more than SSDs.
tools.when_to_use: When using an HDD or low-RAM system where preloading helps.

tools.title: SysMain Status
tools.description: Check current SysMain state with hardware recommendations
tools.detailed_description: Checks the current SysMain status and provides guidance based on your hardware. This is informational and does not change settings.
tools.notes: Effects vary by hardware.
tools.when_to_use: When deciding whether SysMain should be enabled.

sections.title: VISUAL EFFECTS
sections.description: Manage Windows animations and transparency. Disabling makes the system snappier.

tools.title: Disable Animations
tools.description: Turn off window animations (minimize, maximize, fade)
tools.detailed_description: Turns off window animations such as minimize and fade effects. This can make the system feel snappier on older hardware.
tools.when_to_use: When you want faster UI responsiveness.

tools.title: Enable Animations
tools.description: Restore all window animations
tools.detailed_description: Restores all Windows animation effects for a smoother visual experience. This is purely cosmetic.
tools.when_to_use: When you want the full visual experience.

tools.title: Disable Transparency
tools.description: Turn off Mica/Acrylic effects to reduce GPU load
tools.detailed_description: Turns off transparency effects like Mica and Acrylic to reduce GPU load. This can improve performance on lower-end GPUs.
tools.when_to_use: When you want to reduce visual effects to gain performance.

tools.title: Enable Transparency
tools.description: Restore transparency effects
tools.detailed_description: Re-enables transparency effects for a more modern Windows look. This is purely visual.
tools.when_to_use: When you want Windows visual effects restored.

tools.title: Best Performance
tools.description: Apply all performance settings at once
tools.detailed_description: Applies a set of visual settings that favor performance over appearance. This reduces animations and effects for faster UI response.
tools.when_to_use: When you want maximum performance.

tools.title: Best Appearance
tools.description: Restore all visual effects for best appearance
tools.detailed_description: Restores visual effects for the best appearance. This favors smooth UI animations and transparency.
tools.when_to_use: When you want Windows looking its best.

sections.title: BACKGROUND SERVICES
sections.description: Control background services that consume resources even when not used.

tools.title: Disable Widgets
tools.description: Stop Widgets and WebView2 processes (reclaims 200-400MB RAM)
tools.detailed_description: Disables Windows Widgets and related background processes. This can reclaim memory and remove the taskbar Widgets button.
tools.notes: Removes the Widgets button from the taskbar.
tools.when_to_use: When you do not use Widgets and want fewer background processes.

tools.title: Enable Widgets
tools.description: Restore Windows Widgets functionality
tools.detailed_description: Re-enables Windows Widgets and the taskbar button. This restores the Widgets experience.
tools.when_to_use: When you want Widgets available on the taskbar.

tools.title: Disable Search Web
tools.description: Remove Bing/web results from Start menu search
tools.detailed_description: Removes web results from Start menu search. This makes search results local-only and can improve privacy.
tools.notes: Removes web results from search.
tools.when_to_use: When you want local-only search results.

tools.title: Disable Delivery Opt
tools.description: Stop sharing Windows updates with other PCs (saves bandwidth)
tools.detailed_description: Disables Delivery Optimization to stop sharing Windows Updates with other PCs. This can save bandwidth in metered environments.
tools.notes: Affects Windows Update sharing behavior.
tools.when_to_use: When you want to limit update bandwidth usage.

tools.title: Enable Delivery Opt
tools.description: Enable update sharing (LAN only mode)
tools.detailed_description: Re-enables Delivery Optimization to allow update sharing across your network. This can speed up updates on multiple devices.
tools.notes: Affects Windows Update sharing behavior.
tools.when_to_use: When you want to share updates on your network.

sections.title: GAMING
sections.description: Optimize Windows for gaming. Some settings trade security for performance.

tools.title: Enable Game Mode
tools.description: Prioritize games and prevent update interruptions
tools.detailed_description: Turns on Windows Game Mode to prioritize gaming performance. This helps prevent updates and background tasks from interrupting gameplay.
tools.when_to_use: When you play games and want higher priority.

tools.title: Disable Game Mode
tools.description: Turn off Windows Game Mode
tools.detailed_description: Turns off Windows Game Mode. This returns the system to normal scheduling behavior.
tools.when_to_use: When you no longer want Game Mode active.

tools.title: Enable HAGS
tools.description: Enable Hardware-Accelerated GPU Scheduling (restart required)
tools.detailed_description: Enables Hardware-Accelerated GPU Scheduling to reduce GPU latency. This can improve performance for some games but requires a restart.
tools.notes: Requires restart and may affect some games.
tools.when_to_use: When testing performance improvements for gaming.

tools.title: Disable HAGS
tools.description: Disable HAGS if experiencing stability issues (restart required)
tools.detailed_description: Disables Hardware-Accelerated GPU Scheduling if you encounter instability. This can improve compatibility but requires a restart.
tools.notes: Requires restart and may affect some games.
tools.when_to_use: When you experience issues with HAGS enabled.

tools.title: Disable VBS
tools.description: SECURITY: Disable VBS for 5-25% gaming boost (reduces protection)
tools.warning: This reduces protection against kernel-level malware
tools.detailed_description: Disables Virtualization-Based Security to improve gaming performance by removing the hypervisor layer. This increases FPS but reduces security protections.
tools.notes: SECURITY: Reduces protection against kernel-level malware.
tools.when_to_use: Only on dedicated gaming PCs where performance is the priority.

tools.title: Enable VBS
tools.description: Re-enable Virtualization-Based Security (recommended)
tools.detailed_description: Re-enables Virtualization-Based Security to restore kernel protections. This improves security but may slightly reduce gaming performance.
tools.when_to_use: When you want to restore Windows security protections.

sections.title: POWER PLAN
sections.description: Switch between Windows power plans. Higher performance uses more energy.

tools.title: Balanced
tools.description: Standard power plan - balances performance and energy
tools.detailed_description: Switches to the Balanced power plan for a mix of performance and energy efficiency. This is the default Windows recommendation.
tools.when_to_use: For everyday use with a balance of power and efficiency.

tools.title: High Performance
tools.description: Maximum CPU performance for desktops and gaming
tools.detailed_description: Switches to High Performance power plan for maximum CPU performance. This increases power usage to reduce throttling.
tools.when_to_use: When you want maximum performance on a plugged-in system.

tools.title: Ultimate Performance
tools.description: Hidden maximum performance plan for workstations
tools.detailed_description: Enables the Ultimate Performance plan for workstation-level performance. This uses more energy to minimize power-saving latency.
tools.when_to_use: On desktops where power use is not a concern.

tools.title: Power Options
tools.description: Open Windows Power Options control panel
tools.detailed_description: Opens the Windows Power Options control panel for advanced power settings. This is informational and does not change settings by itself.
tools.when_to_use: When you want to review or change power settings.

sections.title: EXTERNAL TOOLS
sections.description: Launch third-party maintenance tools. Configure paths in Settings.

tools.title: BleachBit
tools.description: Privacy-focused open source cleaner
tools.detailed_description: Launches BleachBit for privacy-focused cleanup and disk space reclamation. This tool is external to App Launcher.
tools.when_to_use: When you want a privacy-focused cleaner.

tools.title: TreeSize Free
tools.description: Visual disk space analyzer - find large files
tools.detailed_description: Launches TreeSize Free to visualize disk usage and find large files. This helps identify where storage is being used.
tools.when_to_use: When investigating disk space usage.

tools.title: Everything Search
tools.description: Instant file search (much faster than Windows)
tools.detailed_description: Launches Everything Search for instant file lookup. This tool indexes files for extremely fast searching.
tools.when_to_use: When you need to locate files quickly.

tools.title: BCUninstaller
tools.description: Thorough software removal with leftover cleanup
tools.detailed_description: Launches BCUninstaller for thorough software removal and leftover cleanup. This is a third-party uninstaller.
tools.when_to_use: When uninstalling apps with leftover files.

tools.title: CrystalDiskInfo
tools.description: Disk health monitor showing S.M.A.R.T. data
tools.detailed_description: Launches CrystalDiskInfo to view disk health and SMART data. This helps monitor drive health.
tools.when_to_use: When checking drive health and SMART stats.

tools.title: HWiNFO
tools.description: Comprehensive hardware monitoring
tools.detailed_description: Launches HWiNFO for detailed hardware monitoring. Useful for diagnostics and performance tuning.
tools.when_to_use: When you need detailed hardware information.

tools.title: Autoruns
tools.description: Microsoft Sysinternals comprehensive startup manager
tools.detailed_description: Launches Autoruns to manage startup entries and services. This is a powerful diagnostic tool.
tools.when_to_use: When troubleshooting startup programs.

tools.title: Process Lasso
tools.description: Process priority and CPU affinity manager
tools.detailed_description: Launches Process Lasso for managing process priorities and CPU affinity. This can help performance tuning.
tools.when_to_use: When optimizing process priorities.

tools.title: O&O ShutUp10++
tools.description: Windows privacy settings manager
tools.detailed_description: Launches O&O ShutUp10++ for privacy configuration. This provides detailed privacy controls.
tools.when_to_use: When adjusting Windows privacy settings.

sections.title: DEVELOPER
sections.description: Developer tools for project management and debugging.

tools.title: GitHub Desktop
tools.description: Launch GitHub Desktop for visual git management
tools.detailed_description: Launches GitHub Desktop for visual git management. This helps manage commits, branches, and sync.
tools.when_to_use: When you want a visual git workflow.

tools.title: Open Terminal
tools.description: Open Windows Terminal at project root
tools.detailed_description: Opens a terminal at the project root for quick command-line access. Useful for running scripts and git commands.
tools.when_to_use: When you need to run commands in the project folder.

tools.title: Debug Launch
tools.description: Launch project in IDE with debugger attached
tools.detailed_description: Launches the project in your IDE with a debugger attached. This helps troubleshoot issues during development.
tools.when_to_use: When you need to debug a project.
